name: Muime

attributes.attribute: Name meaning: stepmother, foster mother, wet nurse
Represents good luck or brings the opposite
Extremely bad omen to meet if far from home
Foster mother role was extremely important

sources: Monaghan, Patricia. The Encyclopedia of Celtic Mythology and Folklore. Checkmark Books, 2008.
text: Muime is a figure from Scottish folklore whose name translates to "stepmother" or "foster mother," or "wet nurse." Throughout Scottish lore, she remains an uncertain character, embodying both good and bad luck. If encountered while far from home, she is considered an ill omen, but she presents herself as a helpful sprite when in close proximity. It is thought that this figure represents a relic of Celtic times when foster mothers played an influential role.
